channel.title: Video Game Project - [SPHERE] v0.1
channel.description:
[quote] Hello! I have a new game I have been working on for a while on and off. It's called SPHERE. "But Phobos!" You say. "Why is it called SPHERE?". Well, let me explain...
The concept is simple; You collect these glowing squares to keep your health up (as it is always decreasing), while dodging enemy squares that can kill you (and the occasional giant-ass box of death), all on a 3D Sphere.
This is a simple game with no really complex features (Except the Sphere, of course.) I wanted to release an early version so I can get some feedback on how to change certain aspects and make it better!
Instead of some screenshots, I have an[b][OLD][/b] video that gives a general idea.
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qki6mEJye3s[/url]
Controls are in the README.txt file and stuff. Credits in the main menu by clicking on "Credits" in the lower-right.
A cool feature is the ability to add your own music! Just go in the music folder and edit the "musiclist.ini" thing in notepad. There are groups for certain difficultys, or you can have an "always" list that always picks one out of that group. (make sure to set "forced list" to 1 and set "num" to the number of songs added!)
Leave feedback/ideas and have fun! [/quote] I put that in quotes because I posted that on another forum and I was too lazy to write one for this. I also recommend you post high-scores!
My HS: 149,536.

item.title: Video Game Project - [SPHERE] v0.1
item.dc:creator: Phobos001
item.description:
geekofalltrades:

You’ve posted your game on these forums before; I remember it, because I was a bit unduly harsh in my criticism at the time and felt bad about it afterwards.

But I’ll say the same thing now that I was essentially trying to say then: I wouldn’t play this. It just doesn’t look fun or engaging at all to me.

Don’t worry, I just wanted to experiment with design ideas with this. I think my eventual BIG project will be a Deus Ex like 2D Platformer, where every choice you make effects you and the world around you, and exploring every crevese can lead to rewards!

Of course, I know something like this is very ambitious, but I have created many documentations on how I could carry out something like this!

Thanks for the criticism by the way!
